title: R Package for Plotting Rectangles
text: details install KWB-R packages checkout installation tutorial.
code: ### Optionally: specify GitHub Personal Access Token (GITHUB_PAT) ### See here why this might be important for you: ### https://kwb-r.github.io/kwb.pkgbuild/articles/install.html#set-your-github_pat  # Sys.setenv(GITHUB_PAT = "mysecret_access_token")  # Install package "remotes" from CRAN if (! require("remotes")) {   install.packages("remotes", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org") }  # Install KWB package 'kwb.rect' from GitHub remotes::install_github("KWB-R/kwb.rect")

title: Create a
text: Create "rects" object

title: Create a
code: new_rects(   w = 1,   h = 1,   llx = 0,   lly = 0,   lbl_text = NULL,   lbl_align = "centre",   density = -1,   angle = 45,   col = NA,   border = graphics::par("fg"),   lty = graphics::par("lty"),   lwd = graphics::par("lwd"),   n = NULL )

title: Create a
text: w width(s) rectangle(s) h height(s) rectangle(s) llx x position(s) lower left corner(s) rectangle(s) lly y position(s) lower left corner(s) rectangle(s) lbl_text text label(s) lbl_align label alignment(s), default: "centre" density density shade lines. Default: -1 angle angle shade lines. Default: 45 col fill colour(s) rectangles border border colour(s) rectangles lty line type(s) rectangles lwd line width(s) rectangles n number rectangles. arguments recycled vectors length.

what: Stack Rectangles Vertically or Horizontally — stack.rects
title: Stack Rectangles Vertically or Horizontally — stack.rects
text: Stack Rectangles Vertically Horizontally

title: Stack Rectangles Vertically or Horizontally — stack.rects
code: # S3 method for class 'rects' stack(rects, horizontal = FALSE, delta = 0, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Stack Rectangles Vertically or Horizontally — stack.rects
text: rects "rects" object returned new_rects horizontal whether stack rectangles horizontally . default FALSE, .e. rectangles stacked vertically. delta space rectangles, default: 0 reverse whether reverse stack order. default FALSE. ... used

title: Stack Rectangles Vertically or Horizontally — stack.rects
code: rects <- new_rects(w = 1:3) stacked_vertically <- stack(rects) stacked_horizontally <- stack(rects, horizontal = TRUE) plot(stacked_vertically, add = FALSE)  plot(stacked_horizontally, add = FALSE)  stacked_vertically_spaced <- stack(rects, delta = 0.1) stacked_horizontally_spaced <- stack(rects, horizontal = TRUE, delta = 0.1) plot(stacked_vertically_spaced, add = FALSE)  plot(stacked_horizontally_spaced, add = FALSE)
